title: [SOLVED]820-3115 no chime
message:
hi all,

got liquid spil around t29 area and smc,

cleaned it and replaced bad comps,
now i got fan spin and green light  but no chime.



Cpu_vcore                          1.115v
CPUIMVP_TON                331.8 ohm measured from the pins
PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP      12.55v
CPUVCORE ENABLE = R7974  both sides 3.3volt
U7400                   CPUIMVP_VR_ON 3.3v
                               PP5V_S0_CPUIMVP  (VCC) = 5v
Replaced u7400
Everything measure the same.
 
CPUIMVP_UGATE1G                     0v
CPUIMVP_PHASE1G                      0v
CPUIMVP_LGATE1G                      0v

title: [SOLVED]820-3115 no chime
message: You have CPU Vcore, why mess with U7400???

title: [SOLVED]820-3115 no chime
message: USB mouse lighting up? Beeps without RAM?

title: [SOLVED]820-3115 no chime
message: Well that sucks. Corrosion under SMC/PCH is likely.

title: [SOLVED]820-3115 no chime
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 5099"]USB mouse lighting up? Beeps without RAM?[/QUOTE]

What are you verifying with this? Sorry if it sounds stupid

title: [SOLVED]820-3115 no chime
message: very good question, also wanted to ask that.

title: [SOLVED]820-3115 no chime
message:
USB mouse will only light up if USB is initialized. This means the board has to be working for the most part.
RAM beeps confirm the CPU is running and the board is at least starting to run POST.

title: [SOLVED]820-3115 no chime
message:
FIXED!!!
reballed SMC, i did a reflow on the smc nothing, but when i removed it it had a moist stain on a few legs.
reballed and replaced,
got a looooooooooooooooooooooooooonngggg dong
